19.heading: Texas.
19.title: Echoes of the Lost Boys of Sudan
19.author: lead artist Michael "Myk" Friedman ; edited by Susan Clark.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): The Sudanese civil war orphaned 30,000 youths. Children fleeing the violence swam through crocodile-infested rivers and slept in dense forests to avoid armed troops and wild animals. Along the way, many died from dehydration and starvation. Almost 4,000 of these Sudanese child refugees now live in the United States, many settling in North Texas. This nonfiction comic book series depicts the struggle for survival by some of these refugees.

156.heading: Tezuka, Osamu, 1928-1989.
156.title: Dawn
156.author: by Osamu Tezuka ; English translation by Dadakai.
notes: An English translation of the first of the 12 Phoenix (Hi no tori) stories.

Summary: "With grand historical sweep, this self-contained opening volume of Osamu Tezuka's acclaimed Phoenix saga is an epic account of the human spirit in a time of chaos and warfare, where would-be warrior Nagi and his crew struggle against the elements, invaders, and history itself."

158.heading: Tezuka, Osamu, 1928-1989.
158.title: Karma
158.author: by Osamu Tezuka ; English translation by Dadakai, Jared Cook, Shinji Sakamoto, and Frederik L
notes: Summary: "This fourth volume of Osamu Tezuka's acclaimed Phoenix saga is set in 8th-century Japan and tells the story of two men: the hideously deformed mass murderer Gao and the handsome and gifted woodcarver Akanemaru."
Translation of the 5th of 12 Phoenix (Hi no tori) stories.
